intro: Sloanea streimannii, commonly known as the Andean sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Sloanea streimannii is often found in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in montane ecosystems.
